channel.title: Pwning the phishers: Right or wrong?
channel.description:
I am going to be teaching phishers that it isn't all fun in games for them. They are fucking up people's time on Runescape which I don't like very much. First phisher I am after is one of the more popular ones who inspires a lot of other people to try phishing is Failphishes aka FamousPhishes. He sells the RSGP he gets phishing so my goal is to fuck that up for him while getting his youtube channel banned. (About 1600+ youtube accounts will be flagging his channel.)
His youtube channel wall: [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/qzm45y.png[/img]
Youtube video before I got to it: [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/11aa7bm.png[/img]
After: [IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/2s93tck.png[/img]
Do you think what I am doing is right or wrong?

item.title: Pwning the phishers: Right or wrong?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I think if your dumb enough to fall for all these scams you deserve it, but the people who scam should still be punished as it is against the rules.

Read full topic
item.source: Pwning the phishers: Right or wrong?

item.title: Pwning the phishers: Right or wrong?
item.dc:creator: @Knightraider Knightraider
item.description:
@Knightraider wrote:

He scams stupid people - Really he is doing the RS community a favour.

Read full topic
item.source: Pwning the phishers: Right or wrong?

item.title: Pwning the phishers: Right or wrong?
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“salecko, post:22, topic:389538”]Wrong. If you do this, people aren’t going to learn. They don’t always have comments that tell them what to do; however, if they get phished, they’ll learn, and never do it again.[/quote]You want the shithole to get geepee and expect people to “learn” a lesson? Oh ok, makes sense.

Read full topic

item.title: Pwning the phishers: Right or wrong?
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

TabbyKiller:

How the eff do you guys get your accounts stolen off you? I’ve never had one account stolen from me. And if your scared about phishing then just use your favourites

I never have either but if you watch some of his videos he acts E-Tough which bothers me. It is pretty convincing when 5+ people in a skype call are all like yeah this clan is awsome apply on this phishing link and if the link doesn’t make the kid look twice he will login

Read full topic

item.title: Pwning the phishers: Right or wrong?
item.dc:creator: @nacional nacional
item.description:
@nacional wrote:

[quote=“gravenfire23, post:10, topic:389538”][quote author=nacional link=topic=485451.msg3556965#msg3556965 date=1301967008]
Don’t think he deserves but w.e.
[/quote]
Why not he Scams Tons of people daily, i bet you wouldn’t be saying that if it happened to you[/quote]
I probably would, but I couldn’t fall for it. Last time I lost anything, I was 11. Shouldn’t be too hard to avoid phishers.Those who fall for it are under the same category as those who fall for the doubling money scam, so no sympathy from me. This also seems like “personal army” request so no thanks. Enjoy doing this for some idiot who fell for it.

Read full topic
